object.name: sendDocument
object.description: Use this method to send general files. On success, the sent Message is returned. Bots can currently send files of any type of up to 50 MB in size, this limit may be changed in the future.
object.html_description: Use this method to send general files. On success, the sent Message is returned. Bots can currently send files of any type of up to 50 MB in size, this limit may be changed in the future.
object.rst_description: Use this method to send general files. On success, the sent :class:`aiogram.types.message.Message` is returned. Bots can currently send files of any type of up to 50 MB in size, this limit may be changed in the future.

annotations.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)
annotations.html_description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)
annotations.rst_description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format :code:`@channelusername`)
annotations.name: chat_id

annotations.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only
annotations.html_description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only
annotations.rst_description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only
annotations.name: message_thread_id

annotations.description: File to send. Pass a file_id as String to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or upload a new one using multipart/form-data. More information on Sending Files
annotations.html_description: File to send. Pass a file_id as String to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or upload a new one using multipart/form-data. More information on Sending Files »
annotations.rst_description: File to send. Pass a file_id as String to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or upload a new one using multipart/form-data. :ref:`More information on Sending Files » <sending-files>`
annotations.name: document

annotations.description: Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass 'attach://<file_attach_name>' if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. More information on Sending Files
annotations.html_description: Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. More information on Sending Files »
annotations.rst_description: Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass 'attach://<file_attach_name>' if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. :ref:`More information on Sending Files » <sending-files>`
annotations.name: thumbnail

annotations.description: Document caption (may also be used when resending documents by file_id), 0-1024 characters after entities parsing
annotations.html_description: Document caption (may also be used when resending documents by file_id), 0-1024 characters after entities parsing
annotations.rst_description: Document caption (may also be used when resending documents by *file_id*), 0-1024 characters after entities parsing
annotations.name: caption

annotations.description: Mode for parsing entities in the document caption. See formatting options for more details.
annotations.html_description: Mode for parsing entities in the document caption. See formatting options for more details.
annotations.rst_description: Mode for parsing entities in the document caption. See `formatting options <https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options>`_ for more details.
annotations.name: parse_mode

annotations.description: A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode
annotations.html_description: A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode
annotations.rst_description: A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of *parse_mode*
annotations.name: caption_entities

annotations.description: Disables automatic server-side content type detection for files uploaded using multipart/form-data
annotations.html_description: Disables automatic server-side content type detection for files uploaded using multipart/form-data
annotations.rst_description: Disables automatic server-side content type detection for files uploaded using multipart/form-data
annotations.name: disable_content_type_detection

annotations.description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.
annotations.html_description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.
annotations.rst_description: Sends the message `silently <https://telegram.org/blog/channels-2-0#silent-messages>`_. Users will receive a notification with no sound.
annotations.name: disable_notification

annotations.description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving
annotations.html_description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving
annotations.rst_description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving
annotations.name: protect_content

annotations.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message
annotations.html_description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message
annotations.rst_description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message
annotations.name: reply_to_message_id

annotations.description: Pass True if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found
annotations.html_description: Pass True if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found
annotations.rst_description: Pass :code:`True` if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found
annotations.name: allow_sending_without_reply

annotations.type: InlineKeyboardMarkup or ReplyKeyboardMarkup or ReplyKeyboardRemove or ForceReply
annotations.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard, custom reply keyboard, instructions to remove reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user.
annotations.html_description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard, custom reply keyboard, instructions to remove reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user.
annotations.rst_description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an `inline keyboard <https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards>`_, `custom reply keyboard <https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#keyboards>`_, instructions to remove reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user.
annotations.name: reply_markup
